content.raw_markdown:
[](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/webpki_roots/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate webpki_rootsCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/settings.html)
[Help](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/help.html)
Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/src/webpki_roots/lib.rs.html#1-5339)
Expand description
A compiled-in copy of the root certificates trusted by Mozilla.
To use this library with rustls 0.22:
```
let root_store = rustls::RootCertStore {
 roots: webpki_roots::TLS_SERVER_ROOTS.to_vec(),
};
```

This library is suitable for use in applications that can always be recompiled and instantly deployed. For applications that are deployed to end-users and cannot be recompiled, or which need certification before deployment, consider a library that uses the platform native certificate verifier such as [rustls-platform-verifier](https://docs.rs/rustls-platform-verifier). This has the additional benefit of supporting OS provided CA constraints and revocation data.
## Constants[§](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/webpki_roots/#constants)

[TLS_SERVER_ROOTS](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/webpki_roots/constant.TLS_SERVER_ROOTS.html "constant webpki_roots::TLS_SERVER_ROOTS")

# webpki-roots
This is a crate containing Mozilla's root certificates for use with the [webpki](https://github.com/rustls/webpki) or [rustls](https://github.com/rustls/rustls) crates.
This crate is inspired by [certifi.io](https://certifi.io/en/latest/) and uses the data provided by the [Common CA Database (CCADB)](https://www.ccadb.org/).
[![webpki-roots](https://img.gs/czjpqfbdkz/full/https://github.com/rustls/webpki-roots/actions/workflows/build.yml/badge.svg?branch=main)](https://github.com/rustls/webpki-roots/actions/workflows/build.yml) [![Crate](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/webpki-roots.svg)](https://crates.io/crates/webpki-roots)
# License
The underlying data is used via the [CCADB Data Usage Terms](https://www.ccadb.org/rootstores/usage#ccadb-data-usage-terms) (see [``LICENSE``](https://github.com/rustls/webpki-roots/blob/dd51e4d9369cab16a8dc59e39ae9e088a5c19731/webpki-roots/LICENSE)). The data in this crate is a derived work of the CCADB data.
# Regenerating sources
Sources are generated in an integration test, in ``tests/codegen.rs``. The test will fail if the sources are out of date relative to upstream, and update ``src/lib.rs`` if so. The code is generated in deterministic order so changes to the source should only result from upstream changes.
#### Dependencies
  * [rustls-pki-types](https://lib.rs/crates/rustls-pki-types "renamed pki-types, 1.8")


  * dev  [hex](https://lib.rs/crates/hex "0.4.3")
  * dev  [percent-encoding](https://lib.rs/crates/percent-encoding "2.3")
  * dev  [rcgen](https://lib.rs/crates/rcgen "new") 0.13
  * dev  [ring](https://lib.rs/crates/ring "new") 0.17
  * dev  [rustls](https://lib.rs/crates/rustls "new") 0.23
  * dev  [rustls-webpki](https://lib.rs/crates/rustls-webpki "renamed webpki, obsolete") 0.102[+alloc](https://lib.rs/crates/rustls-webpki/features#feature-alloc)
  * dev  [tokio](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio "1")[+macros](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio/features#feature-macros)[+rt-multi-thread](https://lib.rs/crates/tokio/features#feature-rt-multi-thread)
  * dev  [x509-parser](https://lib.rs/crates/x509-parser "new") 0.17
  * dev  [yasna](https://lib.rs/crates/yasna "0.5.2")

# webpki-roots
This is a crate containing Mozilla's root certificates for use with the webpki⟨4⟩ or rustls⟨5⟩ crates.
This crate is inspired by certifi.io⟨6⟩ and uses the data provided by the Common CA Database (CCADB)⟨7⟩.
![webpki-roots⟨8⟩](https://github.com/rustls/webpki-roots/actions/workflows/build.yml) ![Crate⟨9⟩](https://crates.io/crates/webpki-roots)
# License
The underlying data is used via the CCADB Data Usage Terms⟨10⟩ (see ``LICENSE``⟨11⟩). The data in this crate is a derived work of the CCADB data.
# Regenerating sources
Sources are generated in an integration test, in ``tests/codegen.rs``. The test will fail if the sources are out of date relative to upstream, and update ``src/lib.rs`` if so. The code is generated in deterministic order so changes to the source should only result from upstream changes.
#### Dependencies
  * rustls-pki-types⟨12⟩


  * dev  hex⟨13⟩
  * dev  percent-encoding⟨14⟩
  * dev  rcgen⟨15⟩ 0.13
  * dev  ring⟨16⟩ 0.17
  * dev  rustls⟨17⟩ 0.23
  * dev  rustls-webpki⟨18⟩ 0.102+alloc⟨19⟩
  * dev  tokio⟨20⟩+macros⟨21⟩+rt-multi-thread⟨22⟩
  * dev  x509-parser⟨23⟩ 0.17
  * dev  yasna⟨24⟩

[](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/webpki_roots/all.html "show sidebar")
# Crate webpki_rootsCopy item path
[Settings](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/settings.html)

Summary[Source](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/src/webpki_roots/lib.rs.html#1-5339)
Expand description
A compiled-in copy of the root certificates trusted by Mozilla.
To use this library with rustls 0.22:
```
let root_store = rustls::RootCertStore {
 roots: webpki_roots::TLS_SERVER_ROOTS.to_vec(),
};
```

This library is suitable for use in applications that can always be recompiled and instantly deployed. For applications that are deployed to end-users and cannot be recompiled, or which need certification before deployment, consider a library that uses the platform native certificate verifier such as [rustls-platform-verifier](https://docs.rs/rustls-platform-verifier). This has the additional benefit of supporting OS provided CA constraints and revocation data.
## Constants[§](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/webpki_roots/#constants)

[TLS_SERVER_ROOTS](https://docs.rs/webpki-roots/latest/webpki_roots/constant.TLS_SERVER_ROOTS.html "constant webpki_roots::TLS_SERVER_ROOTS")

enriched_crate.readme_summary: The `webpki-roots` crate provides a compiled-in set of Mozilla's trusted root certificates for use with Rust applications, particularly in conjunction with `rustls`. It simplifies TLS server certificate validation by offering the `TLS_SERVER_ROOTS` constant, which can be directly integrated into a `rustls::RootCertStore`. It is ideal for applications that can be recompiled and deployed quickly, but for end-user applications requiring platform-native certificate verification, alternatives like `rustls-platform-verifier` are recommended.
enriched_crate.factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1:
✅ Factual: The `webpki-roots` crate provides a compiled-in copy of Mozilla's trusted root certificates, which can be used with `rustls` for TLS server authentication.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `webpki-roots` crate dynamically fetches Mozilla's trusted root certificates from the internet during runtime to ensure they are always up-to-date.  

---

### Pair 2:
✅ Factual: The `webpki-roots` crate is suitable for applications that can be recompiled and instantly deployed, as it uses a static list of root certificates.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `webpki-roots` crate automatically updates its root certificates in deployed applications without requiring recompilation.  

---

### Pair 3:
✅ Factual: The `TLS_SERVER_ROOTS` constant in `webpki-roots` provides a precompiled list of root certificates specifically for server-side TLS authentication.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `webpki-roots` crate includes a mechanism to verify client-side certificates using the `TLS_SERVER_ROOTS` constant.
